title: NEW PIRELLI LOGO TO IDENTIFY TYRES WITH AT LEAST 50% SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS - Newsroom Pirelli
summary: Pirelli's P Zero E is the first tire to contain over 55% bio-based and recycled materials. The tire's reduced environmental impact has been verified by Bureau Veritas and is indicated by a new logo. Pirelli aims to reach 60% bio-based and 12% recycled materials by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE. The P Zero E contains bio-based and recycled materials and contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing the use of fossil-based materials and reducing waste.
business_innovation: TRUE. The P Zero E is a new and improved product that differs significantly from Pirelli's previous products and has been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE. The P Zero E is a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The process used to manufacture the P Zero E is a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by using sustainable materials, reducing waste, and conserving natural resources.
likely_naics_codes: ['326211: Tire Manufacturing', '325211: Plastics Materials and Resins Manufacturing', '325991: Custom Compounding of Purchased Resins', '561990: All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers']
greenwashing: FALSE. The P Zero E is not an example of greenwashing because the environmental benefits of the tire are not exaggerated or misleading.

title: Pirelli's New Tire Logo Signals Sustainable Materials - Tire Review
summary: Pirelli has created a new logo to identify tires that contain at least 50% materials of bio-based and recycled origin. This is part of Pirelli's commitment to the environment and to providing customers with more sustainable tires. The first tire to use this new logo is the P Zero E, which contains more than 55% of materials of bio-based and recycled origin.

title: Honda East Liberty Auto Plant Earns E3 Platinum Achievement Award from Ohio EPA - Honda Newsroom
summary: Honda's East Liberty Auto Plant (ELP) has been recognized by the Ohio EPA with the prestigious E3 Platinum Achievement Award for its exceptional environmental practices. The plant has implemented innovative processes, such as recycling scrap materials and developing algae-removal technology, to minimize its environmental footprint. Honda is committed to its 'Triple Action to Zero' approach, aiming for zero environmental impact by 2050 through carbon neutrality, renewable energy utilization, and resource circulation.
green_innovation: TRUE. Honda's efforts to minimize its environmental footprint through innovative processes align with the definition of green innovation as reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. The implementation of new and improved processes, such as recycling scrap materials and developing algae-removal technology, meets the criteria for business process innovation as they differ significantly from previous processes and have been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes the development of new technology to help remove algae from water pipes, which meets the criteria for a green process as it is a new or improved method that minimizes environmental impacts.

title: Lintec Europe launches sustainable materials - Labels and Labeling
summary: Lintec Europe has launched MMP Mono Material Polyester (PET), a labelstock material that assists in the clean separation of PET container waste to improve the recyclability of PET bottles. Lintec also launched a new direct thermal paper that offers superior moisture and water immersion resistance, improved rub resistance, and is microwave oven compatible. Lintec won the Global Label Award Innovation Award for its new labelstock material.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the labelstock material helps reduce contamination during the recycling of PET bottles and the direct thermal paper replaces plastic-based labelstocks.
business_innovation: TRUE, because both the labelstock material and the direct thermal paper are new products that differ significantly from the firm's previous products.
green_product: TRUE, because both the labelstock material and the direct thermal paper reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
green_process: FALSE, because the article does not describe a process.
product_or_process: MMP Mono Material Polyester (PET) labelstock material and direct thermal paper

title: New Pirelli Logo To Identify Tyres With At Least 50% Sustainable Material - indianautosblog.com
summary: Pirelli has developed a new logo to denote that a tire range contains more than 50% of materials that are bio-based and recycled called P Zero E. Pirelli also plans to increase the percentage of sustainable materials in its future tire lines by 2030. For example, Pirelli was the first to produce an FSC-certified tire that uses natural rubber and FSC rayon, which ensures that the materials were sourced from sustainably managed forests.

title: New Honda Motocompacto e-Scooter Redefines Personal Urban Mobility as Sleek, Simple and Uniquely Foldable - Honda Newsroom
summary: Honda has released the Motocompacto, an all-electric, foldable, and ultra-compact personal transportation device. The Motocompacto is designed for urban mobility and has a range of up to 12 miles on a single charge. It is priced at just $995 and will be available for purchase starting in November.

summary: Pernod Ricard Global Travel Retail (GTR) is returning to the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes this October, galvanized by a double-digit sales uplift of 40% in FY23. The company will showcase its latest innovation from global and emerging brands, including an exciting new global travel retail exclusive limited edition. PR GTR continues to accelerate its ambitions in circular making and sustainable retail design, informed by its award-winning Lifecycle Analysis (LCA) tool first launched in 2021.

title: Autoliv and Great Wall Motor collaborate on advanced safety technologies - Autocar Professional
summary: Autoliv China and Great Wall Motor (GWM) are collaborating to develop innovative safety systems for autonomous vehicles, including an overhead passenger airbag and a zero-gravity seat. The collaboration also includes the development of low-carbon solutions, such as using bio-PET for airbag cushions and bio-leather for steering wheels. The companies share a commitment to safety, quality, innovation, and sustainability.
